artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Iseya Rihei
markings: red artist\'s seal: {Ichiryūsai}; censor seal: {kiwame}; publisher\'s seal: 林 {rin} (Iseya Rihei); publisher\'s seal: {Kinjudō} (Iseya Rihei)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Sixty-nine Stations of the Kisokaidō (Kisokaidō rokujūkyū tsugi no uchi 木曽海道六拾九之内)
text: This moonlit view of a river is from one of Hiroshige's famous landscape series. A different edition without mountains in the background is also known. As deletion of compositional elements in a design typically suggests a later edition, this print, which includes mountains in the background, is regarded as an earlier edition. The later edition, however, features a blue gradation encircling the moon-an element missing in this version. Such a specialized and labor-intensive addition is highly unusual in the later edition. Therefore, it is possible that the two editions were produced around the same time.
title: No. 28, Nagakubo
